rev.diff:
Line 174: Line 174:
=== Arrests ===
=== Arrests ===
  +
{{update|date=January 2011}}
[[File:Central Security Forces in 2011 Egyptian Protests.jpg|thumb|Rows of Egyptian [[Central Security Forces]] on the Day of Anger]]
[[File:Central Security Forces in 2011 Egyptian Protests.jpg|thumb|Rows of Egyptian [[Central Security Forces]] on the Day of Anger]]
Activists reported that security agents have detained a number of protesters who were taking part in the 25 January demonstration. Twenty-five people have been arrested at [[Asyut]],<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egypt-govt-security-detains-protesters-cairo-and-assiut|title=Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut|publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref> according to Gamal Eid, director of the [[Arabic Network for Human Rights Information]] (ANHRI). He also noted that security agents seized banners hoisted by the protesters.<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/> Security sources said that Asyut's police arrested approximately 50 young people the night before the 25 January demonstration and confined them in central security trucks.<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/> An estimated 860 protesters had been arrested by the beginning of demonstrations on Tuesday.<ref name="We ran a gauntlet of officers beating us with sticks">{{cite news|author=KAREEM FAHIM and MONA EL-NAGGAR|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/27/world/middleeast/27egypt.html?pagewanted=1&_r=1&hp|title=Protesters in Egypt Defy Ban as Government Cracks Down|publisher=NYTimes|date=2011-01-26 |accessdate=2011-01-26}}</ref>
Activists reported that security agents have detained a number of protesters who were taking part in the 25 January demonstration. Twenty-five people have been arrested at [[Asyut]],<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egypt-govt-security-detains-protesters-cairo-and-assiut|title=Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut|publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref> according to Gamal Eid, director of the [[Arabic Network for Human Rights Information]] (ANHRI). He also noted that security agents seized banners hoisted by the protesters.<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/> Security sources said that Asyut's police arrested approximately 50 young people the night before the 25 January demonstration and confined them in central security trucks.<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/> An estimated 860 protesters had been arrested by the beginning of demonstrations on Tuesday.<ref name="We ran a gauntlet of officers beating us with sticks">{{cite news|author=KAREEM FAHIM and MONA EL-NAGGAR|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/27/world/middleeast/27egypt.html?pagewanted=1&_r=1&hp|title=Protesters in Egypt Defy Ban as Government Cracks Down|publisher=NYTimes|date=2011-01-26 |accessdate=2011-01-26}}</ref>
